description: [The Conversation Africa] Have you recently opened YouTube or TikTok and immediately gone looking for cat videos? If your answer is "yes", then you're not alone: the global consumption of cat-related media online is simply massive. In 2015, there were over 2 million cat videos on YouTube alone, with an average of 12,000 views each - a higher average than any other category of YouTube content.
title: Africa: Cat Videos and Wild Caracals - How the Internet's Viral Trends Can Help Conservation

description: [This Day] The Managing Director of Nigeria Liquefied Natural Gas (LNG) Limited, Mr. Philip Mshelbila has disclosed that the energy sector in Africa needs over $200 billion investments annually to meet its energy and climate goals.
title: Africa: LNG - Africa Needs $200bn Annually to Meet Energy, Climate Goals

description: [The Conversation Africa] The Red Sea region is a geopolitical hotspot. It holds strategic maritime importance as a global trade transit route and plays a crucial role in the broader region's security and economic stability.
title: Africa: Red Sea Tensions - 4 Scholars Explain What's At Stake for Global Trade and Security

description: [RSF] The Reporters Without Borders (RSF) 2024 Round-up reveals an alarming intensification of attacks on journalists -- especially in conflict zones, where over half of the news professionals who lost their lives this year perished. Gaza stands out as the most dangerous region in the world, with the highest number of journalists murdered in connection with their work in the last five years. Since October 2023, over 145 journalists have been killed by the Israeli army, including at least 35 whose deaths were
title: Africa: RSF's 2024 Round-Up - Journalism Pays an Exorbitant Human Price in Conflicts and Repressive Regimes

description: [ISS] Insurgents fund their activities through stealing cows - making it more difficult to address organised crime and terrorism.
title: Africa: Cattle Rustling - a Lifeline for Boko Haram in the Lake Chad Basin

description: [IPS] Geneva -- Frustrations over the pace of climate action and the size of the finance target agreed in Baku are valid from the perspective of low-income countries, especially Small-Island Developing States (SIDS). It is also important to recognize that there has been real progress in some countries at the agri-food-nutrition-climate-water-nature-livelihoods intersection, and this seems to be particularly the case in some countries in the Alliance of Champions for Food Systems Transformation (ACF).
title: Africa: COP29 - Advancing Work for Climate Finance and for Climate-Adapted Agri-Food Systems

description: [The Conversation Africa] The International Court of Justice, the world's highest court, held hearings in mid-December 2024 on the legal obligations that governments have under international law to protect the environment and limit climate change. It's the biggest case the court has ever heard. The court is expected to hand down a legal advisory opinion in 2025. This will shape international climate law and governance. Climate law specialist Zunaida Moosa Wadiwala explains.
title: Africa: Historic Climate Change Advisory - What the Case Before the International Court of Justice Might Mean

description: [The Conversation Africa] Care work forms the often invisible infrastructure of all life. It is largely carried out by women and other marginalised groups, and it holds up communities and societies. It can be work in relation to production, such as in farms or forests, as well as the work of reproduction and care in the home and community spaces.
title: Africa: Climate Projects Take 'Invisible' Care Work for Granted - Why This Needs to Change

description: [The Conversation Africa] The chairperson of the African Union Commission, Moussa Faki Mahamat, has congratulated the military-led government of Gabon on a successful constitutional referendum. General Brice Oligui Nguema came to power through a coup d'etat in 2023.
title: Africa: The African Union Has a Poor Record of Protecting Democracy. 2024 Was No Different

description: [WHO] The 2024 Global Heath Expenditure Report by the World Health Organization (WHO) shows that the average per capita government spending on health in all country income groups fell in 2022 from 2021 after a surge in the early pandemic years. The report entitled, "Global spending on health Emerging from the pandemic" has been published in alignment with the Universal Health Coverage (UHC) Day campaign marked annually on 12 December. The campaign's focus for 2024 is on improving financial protection for people
title: Africa: New WHO Report Reveals Governments Deprioritizing Health Spending

description: [IPS] United Nations -- The Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) launched its newest report on the Right to Food Guidelines on December 10, which focuses on that focused on the urgency of food security as well as the measures that will be taken by the organization to eradicate hunger and malnutrition in the coming decade.
title: Africa: FAO Renews Its Commitment to Right to Food Guidelines

description: [CAF] The Confédération Africaine de Football ("CAF") President, Dr Patrice Motsepe has congratulated Morocco after it was awarded the Co-hosting Rights with Portugal and Spain of the FIFA World Cup 2030 at the FIFA Extraordinary Congress which was held today.
title: Africa: CAF President Dr Patrice Motsepe Congratulates Morocco for Being Awarded the FIFA World Cup 2030 Co-Hosting Rights With Portugal and Spain

description: [IPS] Madrid -- The available data is self-explanatory: business-prompted human activities have already altered over 70% of the Earth's lands, with 24 billion tonnes of fertile soil lost due to industrial agriculture, the excessive use of chemicals, overgrazing, deforestation, pollution and other major threats.
title: Africa: It's the Greed, Stupid!

description: [Nile Post] While touring the facility, Ssenyonyi expressed optimism about the advanced technological equipment used at the factory.
title: Africa: Ssenyonyi Applauds Inspire Africa Coffee Factory but Demands Clarity On Govt Support

description: [Nile Post] As Universal Health Coverage (UHC) Day 2024 spotlights the importance of financial protection in achieving UHC, the World Health Organisation (WHO) has raised concerns over the devastating impact of health-related costs on African populations, particularly in Uganda.
title: Africa: WHO Calls for Urgent Financial Protection to Improve Health Access in Africa

description: [New Times] The helmet's retention system should include a quick-release mechanism for effortless and rapid unfastening.
title: Africa: Rwanda Launches Africa's First Motorcycle Helmet Testing Laboratory

description: [Independent (Kampala)] Kampala, Uganda -- Electrify Africa, a leading innovator in electric mobility solutions, officially launched in Kampala today, as they started what experts see as a revolutionary step toward transforming Uganda's electric mobility landscape.
title: Africa: Electrify Africa Launches Electric Mobility Solutions in Uganda

description: [CAF] Angola and Zambia have sealed their places at the TotalEnergies CAF Under-17 Africa Cup of Nations Cote d'Ivoire 2025 finals after they came through semi-final clashes in the COSAFA qualifiers in Johannesburg on Wednesday.
title: Africa: Angola, Zambia Qualify for TotalEnergies CAF Under-17 Africa Cup of Nations

description: [CAF] Morocco has been confirmed as one of the hosts for the 2030 FIFA World Cup, marking a monumental moment in African football.
title: Africa: Morocco Confirmed As Co-Hosts of 2030 FIFA World Cup in Historic Move

description: [ANGOP] Pretoria -- Angola and South Africa intend to significantly reinforce existing relations, with emphasis on the agriculture, economy, energy, education and transport sectors, Angola Foreign Affairs Minister Téte António said in Pretoria on Wednesday.
title: Africa: Angola and South Africa Aim to Bolster Relations - FM

description: [IPS] Conflict and climate change are closely linked, the International Court of Justice heard. The Darfur crisis in Sudan is one such conflict where prolonged droughts and reduced rainfall have made access to water and arable land increasingly scarce, leading to friction between communities competing for limited resources.
title: Africa: Once Scattered By Colonialism, Today United in Urgent Pursuit of Climate Justice

description: [Africa CDC] On November 1, the week-long residential for the 25 fellows of the Kofi Annan Fellowship in Global Health Leadership concluded in Cairo, Egypt. This marked the second residential session of the fourth cohort of fellows, which ran from October 25 to November 1, providing opportunities for observation, learning, exchanging ideas, and the shaping of future global health leadership ideals.
title: Africa: The Making of a Kofi Annan Fellow

description: [Africa CDC] Africa is at a crossroads. The continent is fighting multiple disease outbreaks amid a tightening fiscal space that is affecting many of our trusted funding partners. It will take collaboration beyond the health sector, adaptation to the rapidly changing world, advancing digital health solutions and investment in local manufacturing - all while bringing together African countries toward regional unity, leveraging our collective effort to respond to public health emergencies and pandemics, and
title: Africa: Africa CDC Head Stresses Linked Solutions for Public Health Crises

description: [Africa CDC] On November 18, 2024, Nigeria launched its mpox vaccination campaign, targeting healthcare workers and individuals with weakened immune systems in hospitals across the Federal Capital Territory (FCT) of Abuja.
title: Africa: Mpox Vaccination Programme Gets Off the Ground in Nigeria

description: [Africa CDC] Egypt's Hepatitis Programme, also known as the "100 Million Healthier Lives" campaign has become a benchmark for African countries. The nationwide effort has led the country to become the first in 2024 to achieve Gold-tier certification for progress towards eliminating Hepatitis C.
title: Africa: Egypt's Hepatitis Programme Becomes a Model for African Countries

description: [Africa CDC] Africa CDC unveiled a bold new strategy to combat endemic diseases across the continent, marking a pivotal step in the fight against HIV and AIDS, malaria, tuberculosis, hepatitis, and neglected tropical diseases (NTDs). The plan is anticipated to play a critical role in reshaping Africa's health landscape.
title: Africa: Africa's Plan to Tackle Endemic Diseases Head-On

description: [Africa CDC] The AU Member States of the African Union Commission and Africa CDC are to develop an African Union Framework to fast-track the implementation of the 2017 decision on Community Health Workers by 2030.
title: Africa: Africa Scales-Up Integrated Community Health Worker Programmes

description: [Africa CDC] An impact-driven, outcome-guided, priority-based, and ethically conducted health research agenda in Africa urgently needs a standardised approach to health research prioritisation, a pan-African health research workshop that took place in Addis Ababa, Ethiopia, from November 21-23, 2024, heard.
title: Africa: The African Health Research Agenda Should Focus On Delivering More Health Outcomes

description: [Africa CDC] Community Health Worker (CHW) programmes in Africa are often hamstrung by two main problems: dependency on external funding and financial sustainability. By integrating CHWs into its primary healthcare system, Rwanda has institutionalised their role as formal health workers, addressing workforce shortages while addressing remuneration through innovative solutions.
title: Africa: Rwanda's Health Financing Model Offers a Test Ground for Africa

description: [IPS] Nairobi -- Despite mixed reactions to the outcomes of COP29, Africa has the opportunity to take the lead in harnessing nature to tackle the effects of climate change and secure a resilient future.
title: Africa: Nature Can Help Africa Make the Most of COP29 Outcomes

description: [African Arguments] Adaptation finance for Africa is falling dangerously short, both in quantity and quality. COP29 did little to help.
title: Africa: Locally Led, Globally Backed - the Need to Redefine Adaptation Finance

description: [ISS] Misaligned frameworks that don't address grassroots realities abound while migrants face deadly hazards on their journeys to a better life.
title: North Africa: North Africa's Migration Governance - Time for a New Approach

description: [WHO] The Global Health Innovative Technology (GHIT) Fund and the World Health Organization (WHO) have signed a memorandum of understanding (MoU) to further expand their partnership to promote access to safe, effective and affordable drugs, vaccines and diagnostics in the area of neglected tropical diseases (NTDs).
title: Africa: Partnership Established to Advance WHO's Road Map for Neglected Tropical Diseases 2021-2030

description: [WHO] New data from the World Health Organization (WHO) reveal that an estimated 2.2 billion cases of malaria and 12.7 million deaths have been averted since 2000, but the disease remains a serious global health threat, particularly in the WHO African Region.
title: Africa: Reinvigorated Global Efforts Needed to Curb Rising Malaria Threat

description: [SciDev.Net] Africa must strengthen health systems through innovation and collaboration to achieve universal health coverage, write Mengistu Asnake, Rispah Walumbe.
title: Africa: Universal Health Coverage Is Not an Impossible Goal
